news.title: Treasury Department is set to lay off a 'substantial' number of employees, official says
news.summary: The department is planning to furlough workers. The move is part of Elen Musk's efforts to shrink the size of the federal government.

news.title: Trump says tariffs coming in April will 'probably be more lenient than reciprocal'
news.summary: Investors worry that a more severe approach signaled by the Trump administration would dampen sentiment enough to slow down the economy. The comments come as investors worry about the impact on the U.S. economy.

news.title: Amazon is testing shopping, health assistants as it pushes deeper into generative AI
news.summary: Amazon is testing new shopping and health assistants. CEO Andy Jassy is pushing employees to build AI apps across the company. The company is also testing a new voice-activated assistant called Alexa.

news.title: The Atlantic publishes full Signal thread with Hegseth, Waltz after Trump says texts not classified
news.summary: The Signal thread included President Donald Trump's national security advisor Michael Waltz, Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth, Vice President JD Vance and others.

news.title: Mortgage demand from homebuyers is strongest in nearly two months, but that's not saying a lot
news.summary: Mortgage rates didn't move much last week, but demand from homebuyers for loans rose to the highest level in nearly two months. Rising inventory may be why.
